meanings: (눈으로) see, watch, look (at), catch sight (of); (처음으로) set[lay, clap] eyes (on); (목격하다) spot, witness
[접속사] than (※형용사, 부사의 비교급 뒤에 온다) [전치사] to (※prefer, be superior, be inferior 등의 뒤에 온다) 기타

meanings.meaning: be glad, etc. to see the back of somebody/something

examples.korean: the breathless excitement of seeing each other again 발음듣기 서로를 다시 보게 된 흥분감에 숨이 막힐 듯함 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: the breathless excitement of seeing each other again 발음

examples.korean: They rejoiced to see their son well again. 발음듣기 그들은 아들이 다시 건강한 것을 보게 되어 대단히 기뻤다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: They rejoiced to see their son well again. 발음

examples.korean: to lose your sight 발음듣기 시력을 잃다[앞을 못 보게 되다] Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
It was she who first introduced the pleasures of sailing to me. 발음듣기 내게 요트타기의 즐거움을 처음 맛보게 해 준 사람이 그녀였다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: It was she who first introduced the pleasures of sailing to me. 발음

examples.korean: Aren’t you pleased to see me? 발음듣기 나를 보게 되어 반갑지 않니? Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Aren’t you pleased to see me? 발음
